meanings.definition: To give false or misleading information to someone.
meanings.sent1: The dishonest website disinforms its readers with fake news.
meanings.sent2: She disinforms her friends by spreading rumors that are not true.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat disinforms the dog by pretending to have hidden its toy.
meanings.sent4: His smile disinforms his true feelings of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds disinforms us of the impending storm.

meanings.definition: To deceive or mislead someone by providing incorrect information.
meanings.sent1: The scammer disinforms unsuspecting victims with promises of easy money.
meanings.sent2: Politicians sometimes disinforms the public to gain support for their policies.
meanings.sent3: The magician disinforms the audience by making objects disappear and reappear.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter disinforms her true feelings of disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The mirror disinforms us of our reflection when it is fogged up.
